intro: Hieracium sonchoides subsp. xatardianum, commonly known as the Xatardian hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–50 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lanceolate in shape. It produces yellow flowers that bloom from June to August, and its leaves are often covered in fine, white pubescence. This subspecies is adapted to rocky and arid environments, showcasing its resilience in harsh climatic conditions.
